Work

Here's where you'll find whatever I've been working on recently.

Autograph Sound

Status: in development

Autograph Sound supply high-spec audio equipment to the events and entertainment industries. The company already had a website, built some time ago using Flash. Ahead of a future full scale redesign they wanted the existing site rebuilt using current technology.

Part of the brief was that the original design had to be replicated as closely as possible. This represented its own set of challenges, some which I discuss in more detail in this blog post. Below are some some side-by-side screenshots.

Using the same colour scheme as the existing website, I also built a simple, responsive mobile site, as well as supplying an updated, vectorised version of the company logo that would scale nicely for future projects / branding.

The multitalented Chris, Autograph’s unofficial in-house developer, had already started work on the backend code for the new site when I was brought in to help. I liaised with Chris throughout the project to make sure the different parts of the “stack” all tied together.

Technical highlights:

  • Backend + CMS: Rails, CaseIn
  • Frontend: Hybrid clientside routing using PageJS library, lots of custom CSS + JS to replicate existing styling + animations.

More examples coming soon …

Tools

Here are some of the tools I currently use or have enjoyed worked with at some point: sass, express, vanilla js, jquery, sketch, gulp, git, gsap, mustache, ruby on rails, angular …

Where possible I like to choose what I think are the most appropriate technologies for each project. But if you've already got an existing "stack" that's fine too - I'm happy to roll up my sleeves and get stuck in.

I also particularly enjoy working with designers and firmly believe in striving for the best user experience possible.

Specialist skills include styling, animations, general javascript and all-round problem solving.

Oh and I make a pretty mean lasagne.
